TopicTitle: Can't continue in advanced construction tutorial

Articles.Content:
I'm doing fine until Werner tells me to move the fuel levels to zero in my liquid fuel tank.  I do so, but I can't click to advance.

I reloaded again, same thing.  He says to change to levels in the 'tanks' plural, but not to move the rcs tank level from 100.  Well, there is only one other tank besides that one.  Am I suppose to have two liquid fuel tanks?

Yes beneath the monopropellant tank you are supposed to have an FL-T100 and then an FL-T400.  You should just be able to add which ever you are missing, then drain it to advance.

Not sure how you are getting past placing tanks without adding both though.

45 minutes ago, Rhomphaia said:

Yes beneath the monopropellant tank you are supposed to have an FL-T100 and then an FL-T400.  You should just be able to add which ever you are missing, then drain it to advance.

Not sure how you are getting past placing tanks without adding both though. 

Your right!


I was just missing the smaller tank.

Sorry, it's my first day with the game, got anxious.

Now, however, I'm having another problem.  I get into orbit on the tutorial, and when it comes time to burn, I can't fire my engine.  I'm lined up good.

Is it something other than spacebar to fire?  None of the keys work either.  Z or shift I mean.
Can you see your navball, or is it minimized? You must view your navball before Z or shift will work.

24 minutes ago, bewing said:

Can you see your navball, or is it minimized? You must view your navball before Z or shift will work.

I thought I did, but I will review that.  Thank you.

I just love this game!

On ‎5‎/‎12‎/‎2016 at 5:26 PM, bewing said:

Can you see your navball, or is it minimized? You must view your navball before Z or shift will work.

That was it, I didn't have the Navball turned on in map view. 

That did it, thank you.  I got all the way to a successful Mun landing on the first try in training.  I successfully did a return to Kerbin, but I apparently came in too hot and ruined my chutes.  Probably should have done one of those retrograde burns Gene was talking about, huh?

The orbital rendezvous training is a bear.  figuring out which part of the burn to manipulate to get the results you need?  Hard, hard, to quote Al Kermin. (Does anyone know the historical transmission I'm quoting?)

The problem is; I can't grab the maneuver node to move it around it's orbit without clicking on the pink thing in the middle at the zoom I need to see the target Kerbin numbers I'm trying to manipulate at the same time.

Is there a way to unlock the middle of the map, and move it around?  I've perused the in-game docs, but they are not very helpful with this so far.

OK, I think I'm about up to answering my own questions.

I hadn't explored the full 3D capabilities of the map yet when I wrote the above.  'Nuff said.
